questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses the third conditional to express a missed opportunity?
options: If she buys the ticket, she will go to the concert.
If she bought the ticket, she would go to the concert.
If she had bought the ticket, she would have gone to the concert.
If she buys the ticket, she would have gone to the concert.
questions.answer: If she had bought the ticket, she would have gone to the concert.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: 'If they _____ us about the problem, we could have helped.'
Identify the correct third conditional structure:
options: If you had practiced more, you will play better.
If you practiced more, you would play better.
If you had practiced more, you would have played better.
If you practice more, you would have played better.
questions.answer: If you had practiced more, you would have played better.
